From Wikipedia, the free encyclopedia


2023 film directed by V. V. Vinayak


ChatrapathiTheatrical release posterDirected byV. V. VinayakScreenplay byA. Mahadev[citation needed]
Dialogues byMayur Puri[1]
Story byV. Vijayendra Prasad[1]Based onChatrapathi (2005)by S. S. RajamouliProduced byJayantilal GadaDhaval GadaAkshay GadaStarringBellamkonda Sai SreenivasNushrat BharuchaSharad KelkarCinematographyNizar Shafi[1]Edited byNiranjan Devaramane[citation needed]Music byScore:  Ravi Basrur  Songs:  Tanishk Bagchi[1]ProductioncompanyPen India LimitedRelease date
12 May 2023 (2023-05-12)[1]
Running time124 minutesCountryIndiaLanguageHindi
Chatrapathi is a 2023 Indian Hindi-language action film directed by V. V. Vinayak and produced by Jayantilal Gada of Pen India Limited.[2] It is a remake of the 2005 Telugu film of the same name.[3] The film stars Bellamkonda Sreenivas in his Hindi film debut playing the titular role[4][5] with Nushrat Bharucha, Bhagyashree, Sharad Kelkar, Freddy Daruwala, Karan Singh Chhabra, Rajendra Gupta and Rajesh Sharma play supporting roles.[1][2]
Chatrapathi was released on 12 May 2023.[1]


Plot[edit]
Shivaji is a refugee and the adopted son of Parvati, who sets out to find his mother after being separated by his jealous brother and Parvati's biological son Ashok (Karan Singh Chhabra) years ago in Pakistan. While searching for his mother, Shivaji meets Sapna, who also helps him in his crusade, and the two fall for each other. Meanwhile, Shivaji battles against Bhairav and Bhavani for harming his fellow refugees, and they all start referring to him as Chatrapathi. Ashok also learns that Shivaji is alive and joins hands with Shivaji's enemies to finish him. Despite this, Shivaji finishes his enemies and he reunites with Parvati. Ashok apologizes for his mistakes after realizing that Shivaji helped him and Parvati and the family lead a happy life.

Cast[edit]

Bellamkonda Sreenivas as Shivaji/Chatrapathi (voice dubbed by Sachin Gole)
Nushrratt Bharuccha as Sapna
Karan Singh Chhabra as Ashok, Shivaji's step-brother
Sharad Kelkar as Bhavani
Bhagyashree as Parvati, Shivaji's step-mother
Amith Nair as Kathiya
Freddy Daruwala as Bhairav
Rajendra Gupta
Rajesh Sharma
Abrar Zahoor
Ishita Raj Sharma as dancer, in song Bareilly ke Bazaar
Swapnil
Ashish Singh
Sahil Vaid
Shivam Patil
Mohammad Monajir
Auroshika Dey
Vedika Nawani
Jason[clarification needed]
Production[edit]
Filming[edit]
Principal photography for the film commenced in 2021. The director of the original film, S. S. Rajamouli, came on set to give the muhurat shot.[6]

Release[edit]
Chatrapthi was released theatrically in India on 12 May 2023.[7]
This movie was a flop

References[edit]


^ a b c d e f g "Chatrapathi: Hindi remake of SS Rajamouli and Prabhas' project starring Bellamkonda Srinivas to release on May 12, 2023". Bollywood Hungama. 28 March 2023. Retrieved 30 March 2023.

^ a b "Hindi remake of SS Rajamouli and Prabhas' Chatrapathi gets release date". The Indian Express. 27 March 2023. Retrieved 30 March 2023. "The wait is over Chatrapathi in cinemas on 12th May 2023. [...]" [...] Other than Srinivas, the movie also stars Nushrrat Bharuccha, Amit Nair, Rajendra Gupta, Swapnil, and Ashish Singh.

^ "Hindi remake of Prabhas and SS Rajamouli's 'Chatrapathi' gets a release date". The Times of India. 28 March 2023. Retrieved 30 March 2023.

^ Prabhas की फिल्म 'छत्रपति' के रीमेक से हिंदी सिनेमा में होगी साउथ के इस एक्टर की एंट्री, पहला पोस्टर रिलीज [The remake of Prabhas' film 'Chhatrapati' will mark the entry of this South actor in Hindi cinema, first poster released]. Dainik Jagran (in Hindi). 27 March 2023. Retrieved 30 March 2023.

^ Box Office: अब मचेगा तहलका, ये एक्टर लेकर आ रहा है राजामौली और प्रभास की सुपरहिट फिल्म का हिंदी रीमेक. live Hindutsan (in Hindi). 28 March 2023. Retrieved 30 March 2023.

^ "Hindi Remake Of SS Rajamouli's 'Chatrapathi' Wraps Up Shooting". Outlook. 21 February 2023. Retrieved 30 March 2023.

^ "Bellamkonda Sreenivas flexes his muscles in first look of Hindi remake of Prabhas' Chatrapathi, release date out". DNA. 27 March 2023. The Hindi remake stars Bellamkonda Sreenivas, and according to a report from Etimes, Nushrratt Bharuccha will play the lead actress. The film also stars Sahil Vaid, Amit Nair, Shivam Patil, and Rajendra Gupta among others in prominent roles.
